name: GENERATIVE Kilim Fars Azerbaijan (special EDITION)
description:
Generative artwork exploring color and the emergent effect of stacking simple shapes and filling their intersections. Which takes you on the journey to an imaginary universe. All paintings are created using custom algorithms in processing.
This collection has an abstract look at Iranian carpets, art-industrial carpets that have long overshadowed Iranian culture as a name and credit for Iran.

Initially, the roots of the kilim rug go back to the nomadic people of the Middle East. They served and still serve the nomads not necessarily as rugs but rather as blankets, saddle blankets, seat mats, or wall decorations. It is believed that the first carpets in history, several hundred years before Christ, corresponded in many ways to today's kilim carpets. Since the original kilims are hand-woven, they also have a significant difference from knotted carpets. Knotting techniques have presumably only evolved from weaving techniques. Nowadays, kilims mainly originate from southern Iran or Afghanistan.
